metadata.title: CVE-2022-2318 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
There are use-after-free vulnerabilities caused by timer handler innet/rose/rose_timer.c of linux that allow attackers to crash linux kernelwithout any privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-128-generic - 5.4.0-128.144
linux-image-5.4.0-128-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-128.144
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-128-generic - 5.4.0-128.144
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-128-lowlatency - 5.4.0-128.144
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1076-kvm - 5.4.0-1076.81
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-128.144').
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11').
